timeline.message:
add revolt support

Signed-off-by: Volker Bier <volker.bier@web.de>

Fix errors reported by Travis.

Signed-off-by: Volker Bier <volker.bier@web.de>

timeline.author: J-N-K
J-N-K

timeline.bodyText: This is not necessarily a part of this PR: But it seems that handlers is designed to contain unique elements. Wouldn't it be a better match to use a Set instead of a list?
timeline.author: J-N-K
J-N-K

replies.bodyText: This might be nicer for you, but I find it hard to read. As I am the one maintaining the code, I do not want to change it.
replies.author: vbier

timeline.bodyText: Can we add duplicate converters? If not, use a Set
timeline.author: J-N-K

timeline.bodyText: If you make it a Set and initialize it as ConcurrentHashMap.newKeySet() you can omit the synchronized.
timeline.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: How is that supposed to work? There has to be some magic going on if the map can correctly synchronize this by itself. There are several calls to the map in the synchronized block.
replies.author: vbier
J-N-K

replies.bodyText: Yes, I can. But i'd prefer not to, for readability reasons.
replies.author: vbier

replies.bodyText: Your code is much more complex and difficult (because it splits the initialization in three parts: initialize the sets in the declaration, add the sensor defs in the static block and add the converters when they are first requested).
replies.author: J-N-K

timeline.bodyText: You can remove that check. It was there because Arrays.toString() is expensive. port and cmd are not, because toString() is called only if the log-level is debug or higher.
timeline.author: J-N-K
J-N-K

timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't it make sense to make this a constant?  ALL_SENSORS or something like that? This would reduce the risk of typos and should also be used in the comparisons above.
timeline.author: J-N-K

timeline.bodyText: No need to override empty methods
timeline.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: ReadingPublisher is an interface. It is not going to work without the method.
replies.author: vbier
